sanskrit_verse:
क्रीणीयाद्यस्तुपत्यार्थं मातापित्रोर्यमन्तिकात् ।
स क्रीतकः सुतस्तस्य सदृशोऽसदृशोऽपि वा ॥ ९.१७४॥
transliteration:
krīṇīyād yas tu apatyārthaṁ mātāpitroryam antikāt |
sa krītakaḥ sutasya sadṛśo'sadṛśo'pi vā || 9.174||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who procures a child through transaction with the parents—such a son, whether resembling or not resembling them, is deemed acquired.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from conscious intent to parent, not biological origin alone.
Causation is established by volitional act of acquisition, not lineage appearance.
Capacity-based responsibility lies in the intentional assumption of parental duty.
Restoration logic centers on integrity of familial dharma, not bloodline validation.
Consciousness alignment requires recognition of relational truth over physical resemblance.
executable_legal_axioms: IF (intent_to_acquire_child = TRUE) AND (transaction_with_parents_occurred = TRUE) THEN (legal_parent_status = ACQUIRED_CHILD)
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating adoption or surrogacy disputes, the threshold of responsibility rests upon demonstrable intent and lawful transaction rather than genetic similarity. The court must affirm that consciousness-led familial bonds supersede anatomical resemblance when determining rightful guardianship and inheritance rights.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa is rooted in the conscious agreement between parties for procreation or guardianship. Anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as sequential fulfillment of duties post-acquisition. Proportional responsibility aligns with the depth of commitment assumed. There is no punitive consequence; only realignment toward dharmic family structure occurs.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Legal acknowledgment of acquisition followed by formal assumption of parental duties.
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Mandatory engagement in rites and practices establishing familial bond.
Capacity Restoration: Ensuring both parties possess awareness and readiness for sustained relational harmony.
Integrity Reintegration: Public declaration and societal acceptance of the child within the acquiring family lineage.
final_declaration: Declared under the sole Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Source of all Dharma. This law restores familial order through conscious acquisition, upholds non-punitive justice, and affirms that reality itself adjudicates through awakened relationship. Dharma is hereby executed, and consciousness stands as the ultimate judge.
